subject: Re: [junit] Custom runner in a creation loop
msgSnippet: Hi, Dani.  Good question! ... Here, Request.aClass(testClass).getRunner() will look at the @RunWith annotation, and will attempt to assign to delegate, you
messageBody:
Hi, Dani. Good question!

On 3/9/07, Dani Zweig <dani@...> wrote:
>
> I'm trying to adapt the custom filter runner posted by David Saff, but when I
> try to run a test the runner seems to be caught in an infinite instantiation
> loop. (The behavior is the same whether I am running from ant 1.7 or
> Eclipse 3.2) Here's a stripped-down example of the code that is causing
> this to happen. What am I doing wrong?
> [...]
> public VerboseRunner(Class<?> testClass) throws Exception {
> Request classRequest = Request.aClass(testClass);
> delegate = classRequest.getRunner();
> System.out.println("Created VerboseRunner with testClass " +
> testClass);
> }

Here, Request.aClass(testClass).getRunner() will look at the @RunWith
annotation, and will attempt to assign to delegate, you guessed it,
another VerboseRunner, which will call
Request.aClass(testClass).getRunner(), which will...

Probably what you want here is

delegate= new TestClassRunner(testClass);

Let me know if that nails it,

David Saff
